channel.title: Quote Forger
channel.description:
Info: This is a little app I made that forges quotes for you.
Examples: [quote="Test"]Hi. I am a test forge quote! Lol![/quote]
[quote="ThAt0n36Uy"]Fuck off you stupid Moparscapians! You know shit about the real world. I hope you all fucking die![/quote]
Pics: [URL=http://fleamutt.com][IMG]http://img403.imageshack.us/img403/3733/quoteforgerdc8.jpg[/img][/URL]
Contents: Quote Forger.jar Readme.txt Forgedquotes.txt Run.bat 2 other jars that make it work right.
Download Link: [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/125273162/quote_forger.rar.html]Mirror 1 (rapidshare)[/url] [url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=Y6L7NBEG]Mirror 2 (megaupload)[/url]
There are no exe's so I don't think there is a point in a virus pic.
Source Code: (beware, its ugly and doesn't follow code conventions :p) http://www.megaupload.com/?d=9F0BTYBE

item.title: Quote Forger
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:34, topic:215594”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=283372.msg2299721#msg2299721 date=1214548112]
I havn’t bothered to learn them. Im usually to busy. But ya, I read your post wrong.
[/quote]Quick summary:

  1. Method/field names must start with a lowercase letter.
  2. Final fields are capitalized (might not be convention - probably habit(?))
  3. Use some kind of standard for indenting. Most people use tabs, but something like 4-6 spaces should do.
  4. Single call/statement = new line. So instead of method1(); method2(); it would be more ideal to do something like method1(); \n method2(); with the \n character representing a new line.
  5. Pick one style involving the usage of brackets and stick with it. CHECK HERE

Those are just some of the common pointers (just about all you’ll use for a while), etc. Feel free to correct me if I’m wrong. ;)[/quote]
2) use an underscore for spaces also

Class names start are like method names but start with a capital.

Read full topic

item.title: Quote Forger
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:30, topic:215594”]I havn’t bothered to learn them. Im usually to busy. But ya, I read your post wrong.[/quote]Quick summary:

  1. Method/field names must start with a lowercase letter.
  2. Final fields are capitalized (might not be convention - probably habit(?))
  3. Use some kind of standard for indenting. Most people use tabs, but something like 4-6 spaces should do.
  4. Single call/statement = new line. So instead of method1(); method2(); it would be more ideal to do something like method1(); \n method2(); with the \n character representing a new line.
  5. Pick one style involving the usage of brackets and stick with it. CHECK HERE

Those are just some of the common pointers (just about all you’ll use for a while), etc. Feel free to correct me if I’m wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Quote Forger
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

m.dog311:

Runescape. All the games on funorb. And I really shouldn’t point out “Jagex” the whole company. I should rephrase that to Andrew Gower. He sits in his big office all day, while his teams do all the work. Oh and ty for the gift k00dr.

Andrew and Paul gower made it, and they ran it on a single server before the team actually started. They had all the content done, then they needed graphics teams, and other things like that. And now people think jagex ruined there game, they didnt, and definitively not with the graphic update that is coming.

Picture this:
You make a great online game, and everyone loves it.

People start selling money to players for real life cash, and you wanted money to be a bit challenging to get.

what would you do? Let people get rich fast, buy everything, then get bored and stop paying to play?
Or keep them working on there goals so they play more and you get money.

If you look at it from jagex’s view, there not bad at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Quote Forger
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

First of all, it wasn’t a gift, that sounds gay as hell. It was merely support…

And runescape, along with their other games, well, are theirs

On topic:
I checked the source, not many lines of your code eh (NetBeans mostly) A thing that caught my eye. You mention before that your code does not follow the conventions… Why? I mean, people don’t follow them because they don’t know of them, but you gave out that excuse!

Read full topic
